title: Ticket #4547: Erroneous error: "COLLECTOR address or hostname not specified in..."
description:
(Currently listed as 8.2.2, probably much older.)

If you have a non-valid port specified in the -pool option in the command line tools, you'll receive the erroneous message 

couldn't locate collector: COLLECTOR address or hostname not specified in config file

When the correct error is (and is shown in some other cases): 

couldn't locate collector: unknown host a,b

To reproduce

  1. Create a ClassAd to test with 
    % echo 'MyType = "DaemonMaster"' > test.ad
  2. Observe expected behavior for -pool a,b 
    % condor_advertise -pool a,b -tcp UPDATE_MASTER_AD test.ad
couldn't locate collector: unknown host a,b
  3. Observe unexpected behavior for -pool a:b 
    % condor_advertise -pool a:b -tcp UPDATE_MASTER_AD test.ad
couldn't locate collector: COLLECTOR address or hostname not specified in config file

This was observed in the wild when a user tried to pass their COLLECTOR_HOST, which was a list, to condor_advertise. It looks something like: 

% condor_advertise -pool foo.example.com:8000:bar.example.com:8181 -tcp UPDATE_MASTER_AD test.ad
couldn't locate collector: COLLECTOR address or hostname not specified in config file
